meanings.definition: An official investigation, especially into the cause of a death.
meanings.sent1: The inquest revealed the true reason behind the mysterious death.
meanings.sent2: The coroner conducted an inquest to determine how the accident occurred.
meanings.sent3: During the inquest, the detective comically tripped over a piece of evidence.
meanings.sent4: The inquest was like a puzzle, each piece of evidence fitting together perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The inquest painted a clear picture of what really happened that night.

meanings.definition: A judicial inquiry to ascertain the facts relating to an incident.
meanings.sent1: The judge initiated an inquest to gather all the necessary information.
meanings.sent2: The inquest aimed to uncover the truth about the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The inquest unexpectedly revealed a surprising twist in the case.
meanings.sent4: The inquest shone a spotlight on the hidden details of the incident.
meanings.sent5: The inquest meticulously examined every aspect of the event.
